result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshon O Baggett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

$1,100.00 to Yolanda B.   Joint and several with Charlie Johnson 15CF277, to be sentenced at a later date.
*8/29/2016 Request and Order to correct victims's last name signed. Entered into creditor/financial area of CCAP.

Pay all costs, assessments, victim witness surcharges, and DNA surcharge.  
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The Court will allow the defendant to participate if deemed he is statutorily eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.   Defendant also advised that voting privileges are suspended durnig the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Per remittitur dated February 28, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP002141 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on January 17, 2018, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment and order are summarily affirmed pursuant to Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Kaitlin Lamb is relieved of any further representation of Deshon Bagget in this matter.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt: Original transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT commencing JULY 22, 2015 received and filed. (27 Pages.)

Defendant Deshon O Baggett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Deshon O Baggett in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim and mother are present but do not wish to make a statement today.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by the state, defense and defendant.  Additional statement by Rachell P.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 131 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 7 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Defendant stipulated to payment of $1100.00 in restitution to Yolanda Baggett, joint and several with Charlie Johnson 15CF277 (to be sentenced at a later date)
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The court will allow the defendant to participate if deemed he is statutorily eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant is remanded and is to report to Dodge Correctional.
Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Deshon O Baggett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Deshon O Baggett in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement has been filed by the state.
As to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  
Parties waive PSI.  Case adjourned for sentencing.  Defendant remanded.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Deshon O Baggett not in court, in custody at HOC and not produced.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant will be testifying as a state's witness and the state is asking for a date after June 29.  Case is set for plea on July 1.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.
At the court's request, case is re-set to June 3 at 8:15.  Counsels have been notified; defendant's appearance is waived.
TOT Justicepoint with GPS

Counsels have stipulated to the modification of bail to $5000 cash.  The court will order modification TOT Justicepoint with GPS monitoring with the following conditions:
drug testing; no contact with any named witnesses
Release is granted for medical/dental appointments and legal contacts.

Defendant Deshon O Baggett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Deshon O Baggett in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant will be cooperating with prosecution of co-actors.  
Case is adjourned to 6-4-2015 at 8:15 for plea.
TOT Justicepoint with GPS and 24 hour curfew

Defense is requesting modification of bail.  The state is opposed to modification as an Amended Information may be filed for Felony Murder.
The court will modify bail to $7500.00 cash TOT Justicepoint with GPS monitoring with 24 hour curfew.
The court admonishes the defendant that any violation with result in a bench warrant and return to custody.

Defendant Deshon O Baggett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Deshon O Baggett in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 12 FOR 38
Original Information previoulsy filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Due to the voluminous discovery defense is requesting a pretrial.  Case set for 4-22-2015 at 8:15am.

Defendant Deshon O Baggett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Deshon O Baggett in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38 at the request of the assigned Assistant District Attorney and the approval of this Court.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court  proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deshon O Baggett in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Deshon O Baggett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing March 26, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch PE.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
